post.title: Python code runs faster in a function!
post.content: It's better to write your code within functions, although the procedural code is supported in Python. It is faster to store local variables than globals because of the underlying Cpython implementation which makes functions run faster

post.title: Transpose of a matrix in single line in python
post.content: Python provides interesting way to find the transpose of a matrix using zip() method . Matrix is represented as a nested list. Zip returns an iterator of tuples, where the i-th tuple contains the i-th element from each of the argument sequences or iterables.
